page.title: 04LEE GREEN RESERVOIR
page.content: {LEE GREEN RESERVOIR. This is a much smaller reservoir of 5 acres, about 3 of which are in our area. It has a number of small feeder streams, the main one of which is Swinden Water. The 21 million gallons that it contains are used for regulating river flows in the Burnley area, and again the Water Authority check it daily. This is a much less harsh looking reservoir than Swinden and the land around it is owned by local farmers like Mr.Starkie of Lee Green Farm. Cows and horses graze in the fields, anglers frequent the banks and gulls, mallard, moorhens and the occasional heron can be seen on the water.
